summary: game of thrones is a story of how toxic masculinity is a destructive force as the hubris of kings lay waste to westeros and ...
body: game of thrones is a story of how toxic masculinity is a destructive force as the hubris of kings lay waste to westeros and killed thousands, and how only eliminating it can bring peace, as towards its ends it is about two queens trying to come to common ground and the only technically important man in the narrative being the one who wasn’t involved in the initial sausage fest. in this essay I will—

summary: Starklings in college headcanons: Robb is that kid you want to hate, but never can. He knows literally everyone, he’s...
body:
Starklings in college headcanons:

Robb is that kid you want to hate, but never can. He knows literally everyone, he’s infuriatingly gorgeous, plays three different sports, and hosts the biggest parties, but he also brings people surprise cupcakes for their birthday and will definitely give you a ride home if you don’t feel safe. He’ll let you pet his dog too.

Jon is that one RA who’s seen it all. He hasn’t slept in years, nothing surprises him anymore, and you can’t decide if he’s hot or scary or both. No matter how sneaky you think you are about breaking rules, he always finds out, and you always end up feeling super guilty. Sometimes you run into him at concerts, and it’s awkward.

Sansa is shyer than you might expect. She’s charming and stylish, yet she’s always too busy to hang out and you have to make plans with her two weeks in advance. She insists on cooking for herself even though the dining hall is right there. You can’t tell if she’s gay, or just really really loves Virginia Woolf novels.

Arya is pinnacle chaotic-good. She’s usually the first to introduce herself, and invites all the lonely kids to come sit with her. She’s weirdly good at math. She’s in the outdoor collective, so she’s constantly covered in bug bites, bruises, and band aids. She’s not a great roommate though, because while she will volunteer to kill nasty bugs, she also steals your shampoo and has really loud sex.

Bran is that one guy who’s super annoying without trying. He has airpods in constantly, and listens to like 10 podcast episodes per day. He’s already heard of every band, and read every book. He gets completely stoned most weekends, but somehow never gets caught. He owns three outfits, tops. He’s a vegan too, but one of the chill ones, which is somehow worse.

Rickon is that goofy ukulele kid in the back of the bus. He’s never not eating. He’s always asking who wants to go camping this weekend. Around two-thirds of his shirts are tie-dye. You can never go get drinks with him because it always ends with him yelling at people to meet him outside.

summary: Heya Daenerys fans! My brother and I were talking about boatbaby and we were debating about how boatie came to be (aside from,...
body: Heya Daenerys fans! My brother and I were talking about boatbaby and we were debating about how boatie came to be (aside from, you know, epic boatsex). He’s read the books and he argued that maybe Dany was never barren (since it’s possible she has a miscarriage in ADOW) while I always assumed it was Viserion’s death that made boatbaby possible. Like a life for a life. What do you guys think?

summary:
Setting: English Stark Estate - Post WWII
Main Characters: 
-Jon Snow (24 years old)
-Daenerys Targaryen (Chocolate Brown Hair)...
body:
‘Voice from the Stone’ AU

Setting: English Stark Estate - Post WWII

Main Characters:

-Jon Snow (24 years old)

-Daenerys Targaryen (Chocolate Brown Hair) (23 years old)

-Rickon Stark (10 years old) (Brown Hair)

Story:

After a tragic accident, the “illigitemate” son of a noble lord, Jon Snow, is left in charge of the family estate and without family. Save one. His youngest, and now only, brother: 10 year old Rickon Stark.

Jon knows and loves his brother more than anything, but young Rickon has fallen down a dark path, as he spends his free time in the family crypts speaking to the tombs as if they were long lost friends. Jon wishes he could spend more time with his brother to help him heal, but he must see to the estate which is another problem altogether. Jon may have grown on the estate with his siblings and received a proper education, but he was never meant to inherit it. Jon thought that he would go on to become a doctor after receiving his degree from Oxford but unfortunately fate has other plans.

In need of assistance to deal with his brother’s newfound behavior, Jon decides to hire a child psychologist. Not wanting to tap too much into the family inheritance, Jon opts for the most cost effective option. Hiring a recent graduate.

Recently licensed child psychologist, Daenerys Targaryen, comes from a wealthy family but plans to make her own way in the world. She could take the easy route and work with the children from her already networked connections, but this case about a young boy that “talks to the tombs” is far too interesting to pass up.

[Test Write]

Jon led her through the estate hallways until they finally reached a lone door that barred a silent room.

“Is this his room?” She asked him.

“Yes” Jon responded with a gruff but soft voice.

She nodded with clear apprehension. Daenerys had no faint clue as to why the boy was sheltered to the deepest end of the manor, but she thought that there had better of been a damned good reason for it.

As Jon opened the door slowly, she could only feel growing disdain for the man beside her.

The room was spacious, yes, but it was void of any color or life. The walls bare and black. The only clashing tones within the space were the light wooded furniture and the white of the bedding. The younger brother, she presumed, sitting directly across from the doorway and facing away from them as he wrote in his notebook; the single window across from him allowing light to shine through and onto his dark hair.

“Rickon” Jon said, trying to get his attention with a few light knocks onto the door.

The boy did not turn from his position. Only scribbling away in his journal.

“Is it time for lunch already?”

Scribble. Scribble.

“No” Jon replied.

Scribble. Scribble.

Jon cleared his throat.

Scribble. Scribble.

“Actually. I’ve brought the doctor I told you about. She’s here to help you.”

Silence.

Rickon laid down his pencil and turned sideways in his his chair.

When Jon stayed quiet, Daenerys took it as a queue to step forward.

Rickon kept his eyes trained on hers as she moved closer and closer to him. She couldn’t help but feel her heart break at his dulled blue eyes. How different they were from the vibrant and cheerful eyes painted on the tapestry in the sitting room.

“Hello Rickon” Daenerys greeted warmly. She put on her best smile, the one she used to enrapture. Her porcelain teeth accentuated by her red stained lips.

The boy did let down his cold guard.

“I don’t need help” Rickon said.

Daenerys’ smile faltered for a moment, at the venom in the boy’s voice, but was quickly recovered.

“Of course not. You seem very smart. I’m here to keep you company while your brother is busy. Think of me-“

“I don’t need your company. I have Bran to talk to. We go climbing sometimes.”

Daenerys missed the pained look on Jon’s face.

“So go away” Rickon continued. “I’m not a freak. Leave me alone.”

“I didn’t say you were a freak Rickon” she said softly.

“No. But he thinks I am” Rickon pointed to Jon.

Jon only shook his head but did not say any words. Daenerys then found that he wasn’t one of many and surprisingly found herself coming to his defense.

“Your brother doesn’t think you’re a freak, sweet child. He just doesn’t want you to be alone while he works. He’s sad that he can’t spend time with you.”

Rickon turned to her with skeptical eyes.

“That’s not true. He thinks there’s something wrong with me. I can see it when he looks at me.”

She began to form another defense but was quickly beaten to the punch.

“I just want you to get help Rick. It’s not right to always talk to the dead.”

Daenerys turned her violet eyes to him in anger but the man only kept his focus on his brother. Said brother simply gave Jon a narrowed eyed look before turning around and picking up his pencil once more.

Scribble. Scribble.

Jon gave a pained and sorrowful look before turning on his heel. He told his brother that he’d inform him when it was time for lunch and walked off. Sensing the end of the conversation, and not wanting to overhear the boy on the first day, Daenerys slowly stood from her crouched position and made towards the door.

She silently closed the door behind her and marched off in anger to track down the idiotic head of house.

[End Sample Text]

I don’t know if I’ll ever write this fic. It’s definitely in one of my most anticipated ones. I have plans on writing 3 fics that will be updated sporadically. Two of the three slots are already filled: ‘A Dragon will Take Us Home’ and ‘The Hitman and The Dragon’. Admittedly, the fic with the son of Jonerys that travelled in the past was supposed to be the third fic but I found that it was mainly a source of inspiration rather than passion. I didn’t feel the urge to write it like I did the other two stories. Every time I have a new idea, I share it with the world because I can’t go to sleep unless I “let the thought out” in some shape or form.

reblog.comment:
‘Voice from the Stone’ AU

Setting: English Stark Estate - Post WWII

Main Characters:

-Jon Snow (24 years old)

-Daenerys Targaryen (Chocolate Brown Hair) (23 years old)

-Rickon Stark (10 years old) (Brown Hair)

Story:

After a tragic accident, the “illigitemate” son of a noble lord, Jon Snow, is left in charge of the family estate and without family. Save one. His youngest, and now only, brother: 10 year old Rickon Stark.

Jon knows and loves his brother more than anything, but young Rickon has fallen down a dark path, as he spends his free time in the family crypts speaking to the tombs as if they were long lost friends. Jon wishes he could spend more time with his brother to help him heal, but he must see to the estate which is another problem altogether. Jon may have grown on the estate with his siblings and received a proper education, but he was never meant to inherit it. Jon thought that he would go on to become a doctor after receiving his degree from Oxford but unfortunately fate has other plans.

In need of assistance to deal with his brother’s newfound behavior, Jon decides to hire a child psychologist. Not wanting to tap too much into the family inheritance, Jon opts for the most cost effective option. Hiring a recent graduate.

Recently licensed child psychologist, Daenerys Targaryen, comes from a wealthy family but plans to make her own way in the world. She could take the easy route and work with the children from her already networked connections, but this case about a young boy that “talks to the tombs” is far too interesting to pass up.

[Test Write]

Jon led her through the estate hallways until they finally reached a lone door that barred a silent room.

“Is this his room?” She asked him.

“Yes” Jon responded with a gruff but soft voice.

She nodded with clear apprehension. Daenerys had no faint clue as to why the boy was sheltered to the deepest end of the manor, but she thought that there had better of been a damned good reason for it.

As Jon opened the door slowly, she could only feel growing disdain for the man beside her.

The room was spacious, yes, but it was void of any color or life. The walls bare and black. The only clashing tones within the space were the light wooded furniture and the white of the bedding. The younger brother, she presumed, sitting directly across from the doorway and facing away from them as he wrote in his notebook; the single window across from him allowing light to shine through and onto his dark hair.

“Rickon” Jon said, trying to get his attention with a few light knocks onto the door.

The boy did not turn from his position. Only scribbling away in his journal.

“Is it time for lunch already?”

Scribble. Scribble.

“No” Jon replied.

Scribble. Scribble.

Jon cleared his throat.

Scribble. Scribble.

“Actually. I’ve brought the doctor I told you about. She’s here to help you.”

Silence.

Rickon laid down his pencil and turned sideways in his his chair.

When Jon stayed quiet, Daenerys took it as a queue to step forward.

Rickon kept his eyes trained on hers as she moved closer and closer to him. She couldn’t help but feel her heart break at his dulled blue eyes. How different they were from the vibrant and cheerful eyes painted on the tapestry in the sitting room.

“Hello Rickon” Daenerys greeted warmly. She put on her best smile, the one she used to enrapture. Her porcelain teeth accentuated by her red stained lips.

The boy did let down his cold guard.

“I don’t need help” Rickon said.

Daenerys’ smile faltered for a moment, at the venom in the boy’s voice, but was quickly recovered.

“Of course not. You seem very smart. I’m here to keep you company while your brother is busy. Think of me-“

“I don’t need your company. I have Bran to talk to. We go climbing sometimes.”

Daenerys missed the pained look on Jon’s face.

“So go away” Rickon continued. “I’m not a freak. Leave me alone.”

“I didn’t say you were a freak Rickon” she said softly.

“No. But he thinks I am” Rickon pointed to Jon.

Jon only shook his head but did not say any words. Daenerys then found that he wasn’t one of many and surprisingly found herself coming to his defense.

“Your brother doesn’t think you’re a freak, sweet child. He just doesn’t want you to be alone while he works. He’s sad that he can’t spend time with you.”

Rickon turned to her with skeptical eyes.

“That’s not true. He thinks there’s something wrong with me. I can see it when he looks at me.”

She began to form another defense but was quickly beaten to the punch.

“I just want you to get help Rick. It’s not right to always talk to the dead.”

Daenerys turned her violet eyes to him in anger but the man only kept his focus on his brother. Said brother simply gave Jon a narrowed eyed look before turning around and picking up his pencil once more.

Scribble. Scribble.

Jon gave a pained and sorrowful look before turning on his heel. He told his brother that he’d inform him when it was time for lunch and walked off. Sensing the end of the conversation, and not wanting to overhear the boy on the first day, Daenerys slowly stood from her crouched position and made towards the door.

She silently closed the door behind her and marched off in anger to track down the idiotic head of house.

[End Sample Text]

I don’t know if I’ll ever write this fic. It’s definitely in one of my most anticipated ones. I have plans on writing 3 fics that will be updated sporadically. Two of the three slots are already filled: ‘A Dragon will Take Us Home’ and ‘The Hitman and The Dragon’. Admittedly, the fic with the son of Jonerys that travelled in the past was supposed to be the third fic but I found that it was mainly a source of inspiration rather than passion. I didn’t feel the urge to write it like I did the other two stories. Every time I have a new idea, I share it with the world because I can’t go to sleep unless I “let the thought out” in some shape or form.

summary: ok but i want Sansa singing to her siblings by the fire while they’re enjoying some nice ale and Sansa is knitting them all...

summary:
On Jon and Sansa
I think its gonna happen. People keep doubting me on this but there’s a good chance for them. I’m not 100%...
body:
On Jon and Sansa

I think its gonna happen. People keep doubting me on this but there’s a good chance for them. I’m not 100% certain, of course but there’s more than enough precedent for it to happen without the show going too crazy. Will it be disappointing if it doesnt happen? Perhaps, a little, they gotta explain the romantic framing of the shots or the chemistry (could be just naturally from the actors).

summary: The Fairytale We Dreamed
title: The Fairytale We Dreamed
description:
by Daytondreamer

“Growing up is losing some illusions in order to acquire others.”
– Virginia Woolf

**Some folks have asked me to reupload this story so here it is, I am reworking/tweaking some things as I go along just for my sanity

Words: 3484, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Robb Stark, Ned Stark, Rhaegar Targaryen, Aegon Targaryen, Viserys Targaryen
  • Relationships: Robb Stark/Daenerys Targaryen, Jon Snow/Arya Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe, Rhaegar Lives, but not without his scars, betrothal, Friends to Lovers, Enemies to Lovers, Fluff, Angst, Coming of Age

summary: News Photos Shows Daenerys Not-So-Warm Welcome in Winterfell
title: News Photos Shows Daenerys Not-So-Warm Welcome in Winterfell
body:
News Photos Shows Daenerys Not-So-Warm Welcome in Winterfell

Game of Thrones is just some days away from now, This will be the final season of the Game of Thrones, Fans are curious to know each and everything about the Game of Thrones Season 8.
